title: Mayor's Constituents
question_text: A small town mayor wonders if his town will support a new city hall building in their town. He decides to send a survey to $50$ houses in order to get a feel for those who support the building. Only $30$ of the households return the survey. What is the population of interest in this setting?

choices.text: The 50 50 households selected for the survey.
The 30 30 households who returned the surveys.

solution:
When planning a study, one must know the population and the sample from which the data comes. The population consists of all items or subjects of interest, while the sample is the subset of the population selected for the study.

In the problem, the mayor is trying to gather data about his constituents by sending a survey to a sample of 50 50 households. Therefore, the subjects of interest in this setting would be all the mayors constituents.

Choice 'A' is correct.
